misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception / correct shift-by-one mental model
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must save the last element, shift the rest of the array one index to the right (from end to start), then put the saved last element into index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap: this matches Java’s array semantics and the standard in-place right-rotation-by-one algorithm. The backward loop avoids overwriting values that are still needed.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output (including N=0 and N=1).
